solution_line_template: The cost of each key chain in packs of {quantity_pack_10} for ${cost_pack_10} is ${cost_pack_10}/{quantity_pack_10}=${<<{cost_pack_10}/{quantity_pack_10}={cost_per_keychain_pack_10}>>}{cost_per_keychain_pack_10}.

The cost of each key chain in packs of {quantity_pack_4} for ${cost_pack_4} is ${cost_pack_4}/{quantity_pack_4}=${<<{cost_pack_4}/{quantity_pack_4}={cost_per_keychain_pack_4}>>}{cost_per_keychain_pack_4}.

There is a price difference of ${cost_per_keychain_pack_4}-${cost_per_keychain_pack_10}=${<<{cost_per_keychain_pack_4}-{cost_per_keychain_pack_10}={price_difference_per_keychain}>>}{price_difference_per_keychain} per key chain between the two choices.

By buying {num_keychains_to_buy} key chains at a lower price, Matt can save {num_keychains_to_buy}x${price_difference_per_keychain}=${<<{num_keychains_to_buy}*{price_difference_per_keychain}={total_savings}>>}{total_savings}.
